register.description: Interrupt mask. This register selects interrupt sources which are allowed to pass from RIS0 to MIS0 when the corresponding bit-fields are set to 1.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

DMA done interrupt mask.

High threshold compare interrupt mask.

register.description: Raw interrupt status. This register reflects the state of all pending interrupts, regardless of masking. This register allows the user to implement a poll scheme. A flag set in this register can be cleared by writing 1 to the corresponding ICLR0 register bit.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Raw interrupt status for MEMRES3. This bit is set to 1 when MEMRES3 is loaded with a new conversion result. Reading MEMRES3 register will clear this bit, or when the corresponding bit in ICLR0 is set to 1

register.description: Interrupt set register. This register can used by software for diagnostics and safety checking purposes. register.description: Control Register 0

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Sample clock divider
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Power down policy

bitenum.token: ADC remains powered on as long as it is enabled through software.
bitenum.description: ADC remains powered on as long as it is enabled through software.

bitenum.token: ADC is powered down on completion of a conversion if there is no pending trigger
bitenum.description: ADC is powered down on completion of a conversion if there is no pending trigger

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Enable conversion

bitenum.token: Conversion enabled. ADC sequencer waits for the programmed trigger (software or hardware).
bitenum.description: Conversion enabled. ADC sequencer waits for the programmed trigger (software or hardware).

bitenum.token: Conversion disabled. ENC change from ON to OFF will abort single or repeat sequence on a MEMCTLx boundary. The current conversion will finish and result stored in corresponding MEMRESx.
bitenum.description: Conversion disabled. ENC change from ON to OFF will abort single or repeat sequence on a MEMCTLx boundary. The current conversion will finish and result stored in corresponding MEMRESx.

register.description: Control Register 1

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Sample mode. This bit selects the source of the sampling signal. MANUAL option is not applicable when TRIGSRC is selected as hardware event trigger.

bitenum.token: Software trigger is used as sample signal
bitenum.description: Software trigger is used as sample signal

bitenum.token: Sample timer high phase is used as sample signal
bitenum.description: Sample timer high phase is used as sample signal

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Conversion sequence mode

bitenum.token: ADC channel sequence pointed by STARTADD and ENDADD will be converted repeatedly
bitenum.description: ADC channel sequence pointed by STARTADD and ENDADD will be converted repeatedly

bitenum.token: ADC channel in MEMCTLx pointed by STARTADD will be converted repeatedly
bitenum.description: ADC channel in MEMCTLx pointed by STARTADD will be converted repeatedly

bitenum.token: ADC channel sequence pointed by STARTADD and ENDADD will be converted once
bitenum.description: ADC channel sequence pointed by STARTADD and ENDADD will be converted once

bitenum.token: ADC channel in MEMCTLx pointed by STARTADD will be converted once
bitenum.description: ADC channel in MEMCTLx pointed by STARTADD will be converted once

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Start of conversion

bitenum.token: When SAMPMODE is set to MANUAL, setting this bit will start the sample phase. Sample phase will last as long as this bit is set. When SAMPMODE is set to AUTO, setting this bit will trigger the timer based sample time.
bitenum.description: When SAMPMODE is set to MANUAL, setting this bit will start the sample phase. Sample phase will last as long as this bit is set. When SAMPMODE is set to AUTO, setting this bit will trigger the timer based sample time.

bitenum.token: When SAMPMODE is set to MANUAL, clearing this bit will end the sample phase and the conversion phase will start. When SAMPMODE is set to AUTO, writing 0 has no effect.
bitenum.description: When SAMPMODE is set to MANUAL, clearing this bit will end the sample phase and the conversion phase will start. When SAMPMODE is set to AUTO, writing 0 has no effect.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Sample trigger source

register.description: Control Register 2

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Sequence end address. These bits select which MEMCTLx is the last one for the sequence mode. The value of ENDADD is 0x00 to 0x03 corresponding to MEMRES0 to MEMRES3.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL3 is selected as end address of sequence.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL3 is selected as end address of sequence.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL2 is selected as end address of sequence.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL2 is selected as end address of sequence.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL1 is selected as end address of sequence.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL1 is selected as end address of sequence.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL0 is selected as end address of sequence.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL0 is selected as end address of sequence.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Sequencer start address. These bits select which MEMCTLx is used for single conversion or as first MEMCTL for sequence mode. The value of STARTADD is 0x00 to 0x17, corresponding to MEMRES0 to MEMRES23.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL3 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL3 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL2 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL2 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL1 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL1 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.

bitenum.token: MEMCTL0 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.
bitenum.description: MEMCTL0 is selected as start address of a sequence or for a single conversion.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Enable FIFO based operation
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Enable DMA trigger for data transfer. Note: DMAEN bit is cleared by hardware based on DMA done signal at the end of data transfer. Software has to re-enable DMAEN bit for ADC to generate DMA triggers.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Resolution. These bits define the resolutoin of ADC conversion result. Note : A value of 3 defaults to 12-bits resolution.
Data read-back format. Data is always stored in binary unsigned format.

bitenum.token: Digital result reads Signed Binary. (2s complement), left aligned.
bitenum.description: Digital result reads Signed Binary. (2s complement), left aligned.

bitenum.token: Digital result reads as Binary Unsigned.
bitenum.description: Digital result reads as Binary Unsigned.

register.description: Control Register 3. This register is used to configure ADC for ad-hoc single conversion.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Selects voltage reference for ASC operation. AREF- must be connected to on-board ground when external reference option is selected. Note: Writing value 0x3 defaults to INTREF.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
ASC sample time compare value select. This is used to select between SCOMP0 and SCOMP1 registers for ASC operation.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
ASC channel select

register.description: Sample time compare 0 register. Specifies the sample time, in number of ADC sample clock cycles. CTL0.ENC must be set to 0 to write to this register.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Specifies the number of sample clocks. When VAL = 0 or 1, number of sample clocks = Sample clock divide value. When VAL $gt; 1, number of sample clocks = VAL x Sample clock divide value. Note: Sample clock divide value is not the value written to SCLKDIV but the actual divide value (SCLKDIV = 2 implies divide value is 4). Example: VAL = 4, SCLKDIV = 3 implies 32 sample clock cycles.

register.description: Sample time compare 1 register. Specifies the sample time, in number of ADC sample clock cycles. CTL0.ENC must be set to 0 to write to this register.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Specifies the number of sample clocks. When VAL = 0 or 1, number of sample clocks = Sample clock divide value. When VAL $gt; 1, number of sample clocks = VAL x Sample clock divide value. Note: Sample clock divide value is not the value written to SCLKDIV but the actual divide value (SCLKDIV = 2 implies divide value is 4). Example: VAL = 4, SCLKDIV = 3 implies 32 sample clock cycles.

register.description: Reference buffer configuration register

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Configures reference buffer bias current output value
Spare bit
Configures reference buffer output voltage
Reference buffer enable

register.description: Window Comparator Low Threshold Register. The data format that is used to write and read WCLOW depends on the value of DF bit in CTL2 register. CTL0.ENC must be 0 to write to this register. Note: Change in ADC data format or resolution does not reset WCLOW.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary format has to be used. The value based on the resolution has to be right aligned with the MSB on the left. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bits have to be 0s.
If DF = 1, 2s-complement format has to be used. The value based on the resolution has to be left aligned with the LSB on the right. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bits have to be 0s.

register.description: Window Comparator High Threshold Register. The data format that is used to write and read WCHIGH depends on the value of DF bit in CTL2 register. CTL0.ENC must be 0 to write to this register. Note: Change in ADC data format or resolution does not reset WCHIGH.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary format has to be used. The threshold value has to be right aligned, with the MSB on the left. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bit have to be 0s.
If DF = 1, 2s-complement format has to be used. The value based on the resolution has to be left aligned with the LSB on the right. For 10-bits and 8-bits resolution, unused bit have to be 0s.

register.description: FIFO data register. This is a virtual register used to read from FIFO.

bitfield.description: Read from this data field returns the ADC sample from FIFO.

register.description: ASC result register

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Result of ADC ad-hoc single conversion. If DF = 0, unsigned binary: The conversion result is right aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused MSB bits are forced to 0. If DF = 1, 2s-complement format: The conversion result is left aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused LSB bits are forced to 0. The data is stored in the right-justified format and is converted to the left-justified 2s-complement format during read back.

register.description: Conversion Memory Control Register 0. CTL0.ENC must be set to 0 to write to this register.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Enable window comparator.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Trigger policy. Indicates if a trigger will be needed to step to the next MEMCTL in the sequence or to perform next conversion in the case of repeat single channel conversions.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Selects the source of sample timer period between SCOMP0 and SCOMP1.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Voltage reference selection. AREF- must be connected to on-board ground when external reference option is selected. Note: Writing value 0x3 defaults to INTREF.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Input channel select.

register.description: Conversion Memory Control Register 1. CTL0.ENC must be set to 0 to write to this register.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Enable window comparator.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Trigger policy. Indicates if a trigger will be needed to step to the next MEMCTL in the sequence or to perform next conversion in the case of repeat single channel conversions.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Selects the source of sample timer period between SCOMP0 and SCOMP1.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Voltage reference selection. AREF- must be connected to on-board ground when external reference option is selected. Note: Writing value 0x3 defaults to INTREF.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Input channel select.

register.description: Conversion Memory Control Register 2. CTL0.ENC must be set to 0 to write to this register.

register.description: Memory Result Register 0

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary: The conversion results are right aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused MSB bits are forced to 0. If DF = 1, 2s-complement format: The conversion results are left aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused LSB bits are forced to 0. The data is stored in the right-justified format and is converted to the left-justified 2s-complement format during read back.

register.description: Memory Result Register 1

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary: The conversion results are right aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused MSB bits are forced to 0. If DF = 1, 2s-complement format: The conversion results are left aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused LSB bits are forced to 0. The data is stored in the right-justified format and is converted to the left-justified 2s-complement format during read back.

register.description: Memory Result Register 2

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary: The conversion results are right aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused MSB bits are forced to 0. If DF = 1, 2s-complement format: The conversion results are left aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused LSB bits are forced to 0. The data is stored in the right-justified format and is converted to the left-justified 2s-complement format during read back.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

If DF = 0, unsigned binary: The conversion results are right aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused MSB bits are forced to 0. If DF = 1, 2s-complement format: The conversion results are left aligned. In 10 and 8 bit modes, the unused LSB bits are forced to 0. The data is stored in the right-justified format and is converted to the left-justified 2s-complement format during read back.

register.description: Status Register

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
ASC active
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Busy. This bit indicates that an active ADC sample or conversion operation is in progress.

bitenum.token: ADC sampling or conversion is in progress.
bitenum.description: ADC sampling or conversion is in progress.

bitenum.token: No ADC sampling or conversion in progress.
bitenum.description: No ADC sampling or conversion in progress.
